doc:
Bruno VeSota https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruno_VeSota 0 Bruno William Ve Sota (March 25, 1922 — September 24, 1976) was an American character actor, director and producer who, between 1945 and 1974, appeared in hundreds of television episodes and over 50 feature films. He is best remembered for prominent supporting roles in 15 Roger Corman films as well as for having directed three low budget exploitation features: Female Jungle (1956), The Brain Eaters (Corman as uncredited executive producer, 1958) and Invasion of the Star Creatures (1962). Bruno_William_Ve_Sota ( March_25_,_1922 — September_24_,_1976 ) was an_American_character_actor , director_and_producer who , between 1945_and_1974 , appeared in hundreds of television_episodes and over_50_feature_films . He is_best_remembered for prominent_supporting_roles in 15_Roger_Corman_films as_well as for having_directed three_low_budget_exploitation_features : Female_Jungle_(_1956_) , The_Brain Eaters (_Corman as uncredited_executive_producer , 1958_) and Invasion of the_Star_Creatures ( 1962_) .
